definition: A fruit that grows on trees
examples: I like to eat apples.
She bought a basket of apples.

definition: A long curved fruit
examples: She ate a banana for breakfast.
Bananas are rich in potassium.

definition: A small domesticated carnivorous mammal
examples: The cat is sleeping on the couch.
I have a black cat named Luna.

definition: A domesticated carnivorous mammal
examples: My dog loves to play fetch.
She adopted a rescue dog.

definition: A large herbivorous mammal
examples: The elephant sprayed itself with water.
Elephants have a good memory.

definition: A limbless cold-blooded vertebrate animal
examples: He caught a big fish in the lake.
She likes to eat grilled fish.

definition: A small round fruit
examples: She ate a bunch of grapes.
Grapes are used to make wine.

definition: A shaped covering for the head
examples: He wears a hat to protect himself from the sun.
She bought a new winter hat.

definition: Frozen water
examples: He put ice in his drink.
She slipped on the ice.

definition: An outer garment extending either to the waist or the hips
examples: She wore a warm jacket in winter.
He hung his jacket on the coat rack.

definition: An object flown in the air at the end of a string
examples: They flew a kite in the park.
She made a colorful kite.

definition: A large wild cat
examples: The lion roared loudly.
Lions live in prides.

definition: A small to medium-sized primate
examples: The monkey swung from branch to branch.
Monkeys are playful animals.

definition: A structure in which birds lay eggs and raise their young
examples: The birds built a nest in the tree.
She found a nest full of eggs.

definition: A round juicy citrus fruit with a tough bright reddish-yellow rind
examples: She peeled an orange for a snack.
Oranges are rich in vitamin C.

definition: A sweet yellowish- or brownish-green edible fruit that is typically narrow at the stalk and wider toward the base
examples: He took a bite of the juicy pear.
She sliced pears for a fruit salad.

definition: The female ruler of an independent state, especially one who inherits the position by right of birth
examples: The queen waved to the crowd.
She became queen after her father passed away.

definition: A burrowing, gregarious, plant-eating mammal with long ears, long hind legs, and a short tail
examples: The rabbit hopped across the field.
They kept rabbits as pets.

definition: A long limbless reptile that has no eyelids, a short tail, and jaws that are capable of considerable extension
examples: He saw a snake slithering through the grass.
She studied snakes in biology class.

definition: A very large solitary cat with a yellow-brown coat striped with black, native to the forests of Asia but becoming increasingly rare
examples: The tiger prowled through the jungle.
Tigers are endangered animals.

definition: A device consisting of a circular canopy of cloth on a folding metal frame supported by a central rod, used as protection against rain or sometimes sun
examples: She opened her umbrella as it started to rain.
He forgot his umbrella at home.

definition: A decorative container, typically made of glass or china and used as an ornament or for displaying cut flowers
examples: She placed fresh flowers in the vase.
He bought a new vase for the dining table.

definition: A very large marine mammal with a streamlined hairless body, a horizontal tail fin, and a blowhole on top of the head for breathing
examples: We saw a whale breach the surface of the ocean.
Whales are known for their size and intelligence.

definition: A musical instrument played by striking a row of wooden bars of graduated length with one or more small wooden or plastic beaters
examples: He played a tune on the xylophone.
She learned to play the xylophone in music class.

definition: A medium-sized sailing boat equipped for cruising or racing
examples: They sailed their yacht across the Atlantic.
She enjoyed the ocean breeze on the yacht.

definition: An African wild horse with black-and-white stripes and an erect mane
examples: They saw a herd of zebras on the savannah.
Zebras use their stripes for camouflage.

definition: A powered flying vehicle with fixed wings and a weight greater than that of the air it displaces
examples: She boarded the airplane for her flight.
Airplanes revolutionized long-distance travel.

definition: A small vessel for traveling over water, propelled by oars, sails, or an engine
examples: They went fishing in a small boat.
She learned to row a boat at summer camp.

definition: A separate seat for one person, typically with a back and four legs
examples: He pulled up a chair to the table.
She sat in a comfortable chair by the fireplace.

definition: A piece of furniture with a flat or sloped surface, typically used for working at with a computer, reading, writing, or drawing
examples: She organized her papers on the desk.
He bought a new desk for his home office.

definition: A hard-shelled oval or round object laid by a female bird, reptile, fish, or invertebrate, usually containing a developing embryo
examples: She cracked an egg into the bowl.
They decorated eggs for Easter.

definition: A tailless amphibian with a short squat body, moist smooth skin, and very long hind legs for leaping
examples: They heard frogs croaking by the pond.
She studied frogs in biology class.

definition: A stringed musical instrument with a fretted fingerboard, typically incurved sides, and six or twelve strings, played by plucking or strumming with the fingers or a plectrum
examples: He played a song on the guitar.
She took guitar lessons as a child.

definition: A type of aircraft that derives both lift and propulsion from one or more sets of horizontally revolving overhead rotors
examples: They heard a helicopter flying overhead.
A helicopter landed on the hospital roof.

definition: A dome-shaped Eskimo house, typically built from blocks of solid snow
examples: They built an igloo in the Arctic.
She learned about igloos in geography class.

definition: A free-swimming marine coelenterate with a jellylike bell- or saucer-shaped body that is typically transparent and has stinging tentacles around the edge
examples: They saw jellyfish while snorkeling.
Jellyfish can be found in oceans worldwide.

definition: A large plant-eating marsupial with a long powerful tail and strongly developed hind limbs that enable it to travel by leaping
examples: They saw kangaroos in Australia.
Kangaroos carry their young in a pouch.

definition: A device for giving light, typically consisting of a base and a shade
